H0.text: The mountainous and partly lawless province of Nuristan lies in the north-east of which country. Pakistan

H1.text: The mountainous and partly lawless province of Nuristan lies in the north-east of which country. India

H2.text: The mountainous and partly lawless province of Nuristan lies in the north-east of which country. Tajikistan

H3.text: The mountainous and partly lawless province of Nuristan lies in the north-east of which country. IROA

A4.text: Nuristan is one of the 34 provinces of Afghanistan.

A5.text: Nuristan is bordered on the east by Pakistan.

A6.text: Forest exists in the corridor between the provinces of Nuristan and Paktika (see East Afghan montane conifer forests).

A7.text: Between the Sovietâ€“Afghan War and the Afghan civil wars, 4 new provinces were created: Paktika, Khost, Sar-i Pul, and Nuristan.

A8.text: By 2021, Afghanistan consisted of 34 provinces and 378 districts, reflecting long-term administrative expansion rather than major territorial reorganisation.

A9.text: The Interior Ministry of Afghanistan renamed provinces and capital cities in 1964.
